content: in this legal case the tallinn district court has issued its final decision after almost two years the case involves a dispute over the ownership of an apartment between two parties referred to as x and y x has been ordered to pay procedural costs of €950 and a late fee x has the option to appeal the decision to the supreme court within 30 days the court has determined that the apartment is part of the joint assets of x and y but a portion of the compensation awarded to x has been reduced due to unpaid bills and repair costs the court considered relevant laws and evidence including a government register certificate and bank statements x has submitted an application to a notary in tallinn in 2002 claiming ownership of a piece of land the defendant entered their ownership of the disputed apartment in the land registry in 2002 the claimant is seeking to have the county courts decision annulled and a new decision made arguing that the court did not properly evaluate the evidence and did not justify its decision the district court reviewed the appeal and found that the county courts decision was legal and justified the district court dismissed the appeal and upheld the previous decision the district court also determined that the county court correctly distributed the burden of proof and that the defendant failed to prove that the apartment was their separate asset the district court concluded that there is no reason to reevaluate the evidence the district court found that the county court violated procedural laws and ordered the procedural costs to be borne by the claimant the claimant is also required to pay the late payment procedural costs
